div.p: ‘Measured at the threshing-floor of the farmstead of Asclepiades to the credit of Hermolaus (?)... on the 12th of Epeiph from the produce of the present 21st year of Hadrianus Caesar the lord by Flavius Heraclius through Petepsois son of Peteus, cultivator, 16½ artabae of wheat by the official receiving-measure, total 16½ art. of wheat by receiving-measure, and through … from the drying-place of Cornelius … 16½ art. of wheat by the official receiving-measure, total 16½ art. of wheat by receiving-measure.’
